cells.data:
• What are the features?
  • What APIs are needed?
  • What requirements do they have on the model?

First, review all the features. List all data, and divide them into groups that make sense. Figure out how they relate to each other. Consider:
  • What's the primary data type?
  • Data source?
  • APIs?
  • Persistence?
  • User input?
  • Data display?

• Got all the features?
  • What view objects to use?
  • What model objects to display?
  • How to pass data around?
  • What is required in updateUI()?
  • Where to fetch data from, and save data to?

Usually used to perform persistence and network request.
Also useful when multiple VCs need the same functionality, move code to helper to reduce clutter.

1. Build out the workflows, or navigation hierarchy, for navigating the app in a storyboard
  2. Implement the model definitions and enter sample data
  3. Build the view hierarchies for each scene
  4. Implement the view controllers and wire the interface to the sample data
  5. Implement model and helper controllers
  6. Update the view controllers to create or use real data instead of sample data
  7. Polish the visual design
  8. At least, implement each model object and scene one at a time
